org.groupby.parser.JSON
Class JSON

java.lang.Object
  org.groupby.parser.JSON.JSON
Direct Known Subclasses:
JSONArray, JSONAttribute, JSONObject, JSONString
public abstract class JSON
extends java.lang.Object

JSON class

JSON class
This is our free implementation of JSON format.

Here below this is the BNF :
jsonarray
= '[' jsonobject ',' jsonarray-list ']'
| '[' jsonarray-list ',' jsonobject ']'
| string
;
jsonarray-list
= jsonarray ',' jsonarray-list
| jsonarray
;
tag-name
= string
;
jsonobject
= '{' jsonobject-list '}'
| '{' '}'
;
jsonobject-list
= attribute ',' jsonobject-list
| attribute
;
attribute
= attribute-name ':' attribute-value
;
attribute-name
= string
;
attribute-value
= string
| number
| 'true'
| 'false'
| 'null'
;

author : members@groupby.org

                          int idx)
                   throws JSONParsingException
Method for reading input string

Parameters:
src - the input string to parse
idx - the "cursor's" position, put 0 to begin a complete parsing
Returns:
JSON object
Throws:
JSONParsingException

parse

public static JSON parse(java.lang.String src)
                  throws JSONParsingException
Parse an input stream and build a JSON object.

If the string is empty, the method returns null.
To recursively output objects, use toString().

    Input strings are :
  • - JSONArray [...]
  • - or JSONObject {...}
  • - or a simple string "..."

Parameters:
src - The input string top parse
Returns:
a JSON object representing the entire string.
Throws:
JSONParsingException - If the string is not correctly wrote.
See Also:
read(String), Object.toString()
